bibl.title: Ah Jack v. C. D. Hanford. Affidavit
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington

div1.ab: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, Vs. AH JACK.
div1.p: Mong Lee Hewey being first duly sworn, on oath says:

I am acquainted with the person named in the above and foregoing petition and know that he is without means to pay any expense in connection with the said petition, and that by reason of his poverty, he is unable to furnish any stipulation for cost or money to pay the same.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 15th day of June, 1894.
div1.ab: Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
FILED June 29 1894 -IN THE- U.S. CIRCUIT COURT. A. Reeves Ayres. CLERK.
In the United States Circuit Court, District of Washington, Northern Division

United States of America,
vs.
Ah. Jack.
FILED JUNE 29 1894 IN THE U.S. DISTRICT COURT R. M. HOPKINS CLERK BY DEPUTY
P. P. Canoll Atty for Washington Blk. Seattle
